USA - My favorite Christmas song is the CLASSIC Mariah Carey song ‚ÄúAll I Want For Christmas Is You.‚Äù I‚Äôll never forget it playing in the halls of school on the last day before Christmas break during our passing periods. It will never get old to me.
Math is my favorite. People call me a human calculator. Still need help?

It is really preference. I find that using advanced settings can help really fine tune to your liking. For example, I prefer my horizontal sensitivity to be greater than my vertical so that I can turn faster. It‚Äôs especially helpful when in a close 1v1 and you can‚Äôt seem to turn fast enough to catch them. Bump up that sensitivity and they‚Äôll never know what hit them.

Correct. It is more of a philosophical matter, which is fitting for this sub. But we also need some science to determine this. Let‚Äôs dive in, shall we?

Ren√© Descartes‚Äôs popular declaration ‚ÄúI think, therefore I am‚Äù is widely accepted as the definition of ‚Äúto be‚Äù or ‚Äúto exist‚Äù or ‚Äúto have intelligent life‚Äù

Scientifically, a fetus develops cognitive thought and is conscious of its existence somewhere between the 24th and 28th week. 

Logically speaking, we can deduce from these two facts that an abortion before the 24th week is not killing a conscious human life.

Yes, I know I used to be in lobbies with those same people. That‚Äôs why I mentioned that I don‚Äôt mind if if they drop sbmm altogether. It just sucks knowing that at the beginning of the season, it was more enjoyable and I was doing really well and now I see people like this allllll the time. 

Your bell-curve theory is interesting, but the thing is we have no clue! I wish they would just tell us how it works. The only reason this stuff makes us players mad is because we feel like we are in lobbies that are too strong for us and we know we could be in lobbies that are a better match. If they would be a bit more transparent, we would shut up about it. (Or at least I would)

Idk but with my 1.7 KD and 6% win rate I shouldn‚Äôt be in lobbies with people who have 17% win rates and 5.5 KD‚Äôs. If they‚Äôre gonna disable sbmm altogether, then fine. I‚Äôm happy to be in those lobbies. But I don‚Äôt want to be in those lobbies when I know there are others that I belong in.

You should take an intro to philosophy class or even just read some modern philosophy articles that tackle current politics or economics. This show has restarted my interest for philosophy and I‚Äôve been intrigued by the applications of philosophy to today‚Äôs world.

If you can watch your matches again, do it. Try and pick out what you did wrong. Train on specifically those things. The more you critique yourself, the better you will get at those things. 

If you have a friend who is better than you, show them your replays or videos of you playing. (PS4 has the screen recording feature or you can do it on PC) Ask them what your main opportunity for improvement is. 

Just work on one mechanic at a time and try not to focus on overall ‚Äúgood‚Äù or ‚Äúbad‚Äù ‚Äî and remember to have fun! Everyone sucks until they start to fine tune themselves. I‚Äôm an awful gamer, but have improved tremendously by doing what I suggested above. 

Cheers!

I looked this up after realizing I was being put in stronger lobbies. It‚Äôs painfully obvious when it happens while you‚Äôre playing.

No, we‚Äôve slowly rolled away taxes on the rich and many regulations due to the wealthy essentially buying and paying for our government. The wealth inequality wasn‚Äôt always as great as it is now. The gap is widening and will only lead to a class war.

This may be of good reading to you. I‚Äôm not trying to shove anything down your throat, but I think this is a very good write-up on the problem with wealth inequality. At least read it to see where others are coming from. https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/monkey-cage/wp/2014/03/28/should-we-care-about-inequality-lets-ask-a-philosopher/
Kid, I hate to break it to you but they don‚Äôt give a single fuck about you.

It‚Äôs just annoying to only be allowed a 3 k/d before they move you to a more difficult lobby. And same thing. I have friends that don‚Äôt like to play squads with me anymore because we die almost instantly upon dropping in my lobbies.

Who said there shouldn‚Äôt be people like Elon Musk? People should absolutely be able to make money. I don‚Äôt think everyone needs to have the same income. I‚Äôm saying we cannot allow the disparity of wealth to increase as it is. Fuck you people worship the rich like if they see you defend them you‚Äôll get noticed and they‚Äôll spare you a nickel or something.

That‚Äôs 80k. My latest salary was right under that and I‚Äôm in my late 20‚Äôs. Next will most definitely be higher. I‚Äôm not a pessimist, I just see the state of the world and how many people are getting screwed over. When I talk about the rich, I‚Äôm not talking about the people who make 100 or even 300k a year. That is very middle class.

You call them high wages if you want, but people only want wages that are proportionate. No one is suggesting outrageously high wages. Those at the top are taking tax cuts and other subsidies and claiming it trickles down. It doesn‚Äôt. There is absolutely an increase in wealth disparity and it is hurting American citizens in many ways. The numbers don‚Äôt lie. Your feelings that people think they‚Äôre ‚Äúentitled‚Äù are completely subjective. I think that those at the top have a moral obligation to help their fellow humans by not exploiting laborers and government so that they can have more while others get less, but that‚Äôs just my opinion. If you think it should be a free for all and anyone should be able to screw others over so they have more, then that‚Äôs your opinion. The world would be a much nicer place if people gave a single fuck about others and didn‚Äôt have to feel like they‚Äôre ‚Äúwinning‚Äù or better than others. What‚Äôs the point?

I wouldn‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a vast majority, but I have no numbers to go off of. It would be interesting to see. I really doubt that it would be over half, though. I don‚Äôt see it as an excuse to allow an increasing gap in wages. It isn‚Äôt just about Chipotle. It‚Äôs about growing wealth disparity as a whole. This article points out Chipotle like it‚Äôs the only one, but it‚Äôs almost all of them.
Never thought of this, but it happens to me a lot too. Sucks when you‚Äôre building up and then realized you‚Äôve got windows on all sides of you
Best show on television!!

And also this implies that if you take a vacation and decide to visit a Chipotle in a high COL city, you don‚Äôt think the person making your food is worthy of having a place to live because of where they work. Damn.

The CEO is making 1,600x more than the employees. I just wouldn‚Äôt feel great knowing someone was working a hard job for me and I didn‚Äôt pay them enough to have a place to live, while I use their cheap labor to increase my salary every year. 

I have a friend who is an engineer for Apple. His salary sounds awesome on paper, but the Bay Area and Silicon Valley in general cost so much to live that he didn‚Äôt really see an increase in quality of life when he moved for the job. At least he gets paid enough to be able to afford a place. Software engineers in areas with a huge COL should be paid more too. Wages across the board are not keeping up with inflation and the rich are profiting off of this problem. 

The point isn‚Äôt paying people a fortune, it‚Äôs paying them enough to live on and closing the gap between the rich and poor, which is the greatest it‚Äôs ever been. $10 may be fair in some parts of the country, but not everywhere. Of course a Chipotle employee won‚Äôt make the same as a software engineer. No one is suggesting they should be.
Increase your dead zone for your right stick in the settings. I can help you if you need.
To be fair, capitalism isn‚Äôt the problem. It‚Äôs when it goes unchecked that it becomes a problem. Shame on us for letting the wealth disparity grow this much. Fuck Ronald Reagan.
Username checks out.

$10 an hour is not a living wage everywhere in America. People in these places still have families and obligations where they grew up and not everyone can move to a place with a lower COL. Plus, if all the poor move to one area, what would that be like? I‚Äôm not saying folding burritos should gain extreme wealth, but it should be enough for someone to work 40 hours a week and afford to live while having an appropriate quality of life. Mental health is so bad in this country and people wonder why.
No one said the CEO shouldn‚Äôt make more money than the employees. They‚Äôre saying there is too much of a gap. It‚Äôs disproportionate.
Waged labor isn‚Äôt the issue. It‚Äôs exploitative waged labor.

That isn‚Äôt the case everywhere in the country. And before someone says this, it is not a solution to tell people ‚Äújust move.‚Äù Someone in the higher COL areas still has to do those jobs, not to mention people have family obligations, elderly to take care of, etc. and a huge cost barrier to moving that people living paycheck to paycheck can not afford. I grew up in Indiana where the COL is low, but now live in California due to a job moving me here. I lost that good paying (for Indiana - mediocre paying for California) job awhile ago (job interview on Wednesday - wish me luck!) and saw how quickly the difference can affect people who make a lower income. And I‚Äôm not even in the most expensive spot here. The expensive spots still have Chipotle‚Äôs and those employees should still be able to afford a basic apartment with bills, food, and transportation. Right now they can‚Äôt, and the increase in distance between CEO and employee income continues to increase. 

It doesn‚Äôt stop at the frontline workers. I worked in the marketing department for another well known restaurant chain and the salary was not proportionate to what someone in that role should be making in 2019. Maybe in 2010 it would have been fine, but COL is rising at a very high rate and wages (across the board) are not keeping up because those at the top profit from the increased COL at their own employees‚Äô expense; not to mention at taxpayers‚Äô expense. With lower wages, many have to resort to government assistance programs that are funded by us taxpayers. 

When minimum wage goes up, those at the top increase prices because they refuse to make a little bit less and this becomes a vicious circle. They are focused on a YOY increase and will do whatever they need to get it, even if it means forcing their employees into a YOY decrease (effectively speaking - taking inflation and hours worked into account - they won‚Äôt reduce the hourly rate - they‚Äôll run their businesses with fewer people and demand greater results from the few working, causing stress upon those that are trying to make ends meet)

Of course CEO‚Äôs and those at the top should make more than the frontline worker. Nobody is arguing that. What we don‚Äôt want is for them to increase the wealth disparity in America, which is hurting us. A 2015 study by the International Monetary Fund found that ‚Äúif the income share of the top 20% (the rich) increases, then GDP growth actually declines over the medium term, suggesting that the benefits do not trickle down‚Äù while ‚Äúan increase in the income share of the bottom 20% (the poor) is associated with higher GDP growth.‚Äù 

This is getting to be longer than I intended, but research the numbers for yourself of wealth distribution in our country. It is alarming how much the  gap has grown, and something needs to be done to stop it or our citizens will suffer (they already are) while a strong part of the population chooses to side with the top 20% because they‚Äôre convinced that one day they‚Äôll be rich and that they should think like the rich think. The problem is, the rich are one step ahead of them and will always make sure the bottom 80% don‚Äôt get what they have.

I personally don‚Äôt get the circle jerk of people obsessed with looking down on fast food workers. They work hard for 40 hours a week (or however many hours they can get while their employers try to dodge fees and taxes and health insurance).The wages of fast food workers have not grown proportionately with inflation and increased cost of living. As profits have increased, companies have decided to pocket the money and leave their employees in the dust and continue to pay them less than it costs to live. It‚Äôs not illegal, but it is morally wrong and screws over people who work hard 40 hours a week. And the audacity of middle class people to say they don‚Äôt deserve a living wage is beyond me. This trend won‚Äôt stop at the fast food industry. People tend to forget that our country‚Äôs greatest economic period was when corporations were more regulated and there wasn‚Äôt such a disproportion of wealth.
I call the wooded area between Risky Reels and Frenzy Farm ‚ÄúWannabe Stonehenge‚Äù

When a squad match has players who can actually work together, it‚Äôs almost whole different game from solos. I enjoy squads far more than solos. Most annoying is hot dropping after I have already marked a good drop point so I follow and they die almost instantly and disconnect immediately, leaving me solo. I‚Äôd say that happens a good 30%+ of the time I play fills. I‚Äôm on a break from the game for now,  but damn that was annoying.

I think sbmm is a good thing but only if it works right. I am getting killed by people with 2-3x the k/d I have, which continues to dwindle because I‚Äôm at ~30 zero kill games in a row. It‚Äôs unplayable for me at this point. Just a week ago or so it was fun. I had a 6.9% win rate and a 1.45 k/d ... now I‚Äôm at 5.4% win and 1.32 k/d because I can‚Äôt get any kills. Yeah, I know. Get better. But I play ALLLLLL the time. I‚Äôm tier 244. I‚Äôm trying. The past few days have been a nightmare. I just want to go back to the lobbies I was in before. It wasn‚Äôt like i was stomping people. Ugh.

Also does anyone know if they realized they fucked up after we get 20+ zero kill games in a row because there‚Äôs no way we can compete? Or do I have to start a new epic account? I‚Äôve already spent too much money on this shit to start over. I need answers or I‚Äôm done with it all.
I feel it hard tonight. So fucking annoying. What made them think I belong in these lobbies. At least give us an option to lower difficulty or something. Fuck.

I feel you. If you need help let me know and I‚Äôll help you out. I think fill squad members should be penalized from readying up for 5 minutes when they disconnect before their reboot expires.

My apologies. I didn‚Äôt see you said mods. I thought you meant Epic. 

The point still stands that being hateful helps no one.
You catch more flies with honey than vinegar. They‚Äôre just trying to walk the line between pleasing players and doing what their boss tells them to do.

I would just like to thank you for acknowledging players that have concerns. I have more questions than concerns, since sbmm seems to be somewhat of a mystery and therefore easy to place blame on. 

If an average/below average player has a good streak where they are winning some matches or have a squad that carries them to wins and sbmm puts them into a higher skilled lobby than they belong, is there a way for the system to demote them back to a more appropriate lobby? Many people feel like they‚Äôve been put into lobbies with players much more skilled than them (myself included) It really takes the fun out of the game to repeatedly get murdered upon landing every game or we end up hiding and camping out because we know we‚Äôre no match for the players in our lobbies. 

This doesn‚Äôt apply to me, but I know many highly skilled console players are concerned about the competitive advantages of PC players in their lobbies where every millisecond counts and their system can‚Äôt keep up. They don‚Äôt think crossplay makes sense on that level. 

Thanks again for listening to the players.
Exactly. But something should be done to discourage the behavior.

Ranked doesn‚Äôt have fill matches. I‚Äôm not saying one time. I mean a system that sees a pattern, gives a warning first before leaving the match (you‚Äôve left X matches in the last 120 minutes before your reboot card was expired, leaving this match early will result in a 10 minute waiting weird before being able to ready up) ‚Äî something like that. I know shit happens, but it should be discouraged from being standard practice to disconnect as soon as you‚Äôre knocked/killed.

You don‚Äôt ‚Äúget good‚Äù by screwing other people‚Äôs game either. If you want to play until you get killed and then ready up again, play solo. You‚Äôll ‚Äúget good‚Äù by learning from your death if it‚Äôs that hard. You‚Äôre throwing a big middle finger to your squadmates when you disconnect as they‚Äôre trying to come revive or reboot you.

If they‚Äôre trying to get you and you see them going for it, it‚Äôs respectful to let them try. It‚Äôs only 90 seconds before your card expires. If they‚Äôre that bad how did you die first? If you don‚Äôt like playing with randoms, play solo or don‚Äôt put fill on.

Then disconnect before dropping if you know they don‚Äôt have mics. That doesn‚Äôt bother me as much as me already putting my time/energy into reviving them. Plus, I have a mic and always communicate so that‚Äôs not my issue. It‚Äôs pussy ass bitches who cry when they get knocked or killed so they disconnect. Part of the game is reviving and rebooting teammates. Quit shitting on other‚Äôs game experience because you got knocked.

There should be a distance rule. Like a warning/confirmation screen will show if your card has been picked up or if your squadmate is within a certain distance from your card saying you will be penalized.
I think he misunderstood and thinks people want sbmm undone altogether. All people want is for forced crossplay to be removed between console and pc.

I leave only if the last squadmate who can get my card is halfway across the map and I know it‚Äôs impossible. Even then, if I see them turn around and go for it I usually stay until it expires out of respect.

Exactly. You have found it more enjoyable not being in those lobbies. The skilled console players are asking for forced cross play to be removed from the sbmm for those tiers. They‚Äôre not trying to stick you with the sweats. If Epic implements what these players want, you will be in the same lobbies with PC players of your skill level. You shouldn‚Äôt see a change from what you‚Äôre experiencing now.

Please don‚Äôt take this the wrong way but if you aren‚Äôt at that skill level, you won‚Äôt be put into their lobbies. Neither will I, but I have friends that are very good console players and I‚Äôve played squads with them and seen what they mean. It only affects players in high skilled lobbies who have to make every millisecond count.

I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre the type of PC player that OP doesn‚Äôt want in their lobbies. They‚Äôre getting edited on faster than they can even see a refreshed frame and it‚Äôs a problem for many console players right now.
Thank you. I had no clue it could be used for longer distances. I woke up still pissed off about it and decided to post. Thanks for the kind and straightforward answer. I appreciate it.
